Pioneer Day and Christmas in the Park | Town of Mayo Happenings Toggle navigation Home Having Fun in Lafayette County Fla Where to Get What You Need Child Care Centers Food Gas and Supplies Government Services Mayo Business Directory Medical Services Places of Worship Schools Support Local Artists Utilities Contact Us Privacy Policy Events in the Area , Have Fun in Lafayette County Fl , Lafayette County Government , Lafayette County Schools , Parks and Recreation Pioneer Day and Christmas in the Park by jolenemac78 November 13, 2020 No Comments Just saw the announcement on the Lafayette Activities Group Page on Facebook: We’re only one month away from Pioneer Day/Christmas in the Park. Here are a few details to help everyone make their plans to attend. FRIDAY Miss Mayo 2020 pageant 6:00 pm at LHS please contact Krystin @ (386)688-2209 for information Dance Party with DJ & vendors in the park 6-9:00 pm SATURDAY Shop with vendors in the park, eat some delicious food, enjoy a great line up of live entertainment and catch up with old friends and make some new. Pioneer Christmas parade (down Main Street) will begin at 6:00 pm and will bring Santa to the park for the little ones to share their Christmas wishes and parents can snap a quick picture. Contact Heather @ (386) 965-6747 for parade information. We look forward to seeing everyone there And here is the announcement from an October 10, 2020 post just in case you miss that one. Lafayette Activities Group would like to invite everybody to “A Pioneer Christmas”. December 11th and 12th. Veterans Memorial Park, Mayo, Fl Dec. 11th, Ms. Mayo and Little Ms. Mayo will be crowned. December 12th, we have some great entertainment scheduled. So, come and shop, maybe grab a bite to eat… Santa will be joining us for the parade at 6 p.m. on Saturday. For more info contact L.A G. If you are wanting to participate as a vendor or in the parade then you will have to use the contact information in the above posts or message administrators of the Lafayette Activities Group page. Send us some pictures of your Ms. Mayo or Little Miss Mayo contestant, your band that is playing the event, or even your vendor booth. We would gladly post your information, pictures, and links on the next post to get some free publicity going for you. We would also like to start receiving pictures of ALL the businesses in Lafayette County Florida. It would be great if you can send us a picture of your business card as well as the outside front entrance of your business (if that is applicable) so that we can update on Business Directory. There is no charge for this either. We would love to support local businesses. If you work from home (even a farm or dairy) we want to list you as well. If you sell to the public we would love to feature you and yours in a news update HAPPY THANKSGIVING EVERYONE – BE SAFE OUT THERE * **DISCLAIMER*** This is an informational website only! We do not have a direct connection with the Town or County Government officials. We only want to share fun and informative information about Lafayette County Florida. So please stop asking us for information that is better gotten from their official sources. We have listed each department and their phone number on the Government Page that includes building inspection, zoning, parks and recreation, etc. Please call them during regular business hours with your questions.                         in-service meeting. Saturday Student Services will be available on February 24 from
                        9 am - 2 pm in the Welcome Center. All offices resume regular hours on Monday. Thank
                        you! We Moved! Find us in Student Services. The Veterans Resource Center has moved to the newly renovated Student Services Building
                        in Room 213. Named as one of Military Times' Best for Vets: Colleges in 2024 Welcome, Veterans Veterans Services' mission at Moreno Valley College is to serve Veterans with dignity,
                  respect and honor. Veterans Services is committed to provide effective and timely
                  services in a safe, challenging and supportive learning environment that will prepare
                  MVC Veteran students to pursue their future academic and career endeavors. We offer
                  support to MVC Veteran students through the Veterans Resource Center. Our Services The Veterans Resource Center can assist you based on your benefits status. Choose
                        whether you're a new, continuing or previous benefit user. New I've never previously used VA educational benefits and wish to apply Continuing I've used benefits at MVC in the previous term and wish to continue Previous I've used VA benefits at another institution and want to transfer them to MVC About VA Education Programs and Benefits More Videos: About Post-9/11 GI Bill® Benefits About VA Educational Benefit Programs Prepare for the new term! Full-time enrollment for fall and spring terms is 12 units or more. Students enrolling
                     in courses must take at least 1 unit of an approved "in-resident" (in-person/F2F)
                     or hybrid (HYB) class to continue to receive the MHA at the resident rate. Otherwise,
                     you will receive the online rate, which is half the national average. If you have questions regarding the in-resident requirement for VA educational benefits,
                     please contact the VRC by phone at (951) 571-6247 or by email at veterans@mvc.edu . Virtual VRC Email Veterans Services About ConexEd Student Support Veterans Resources From academic counseling to information about employment, housing and legal assistance,
                                 learn about the resources available to you as a veteran or dependent. Frequently Asked Questions If you have questions, we have answers. Take a moment to review our frequently asked
                                 questions and if you still need help, give Veterans Services a call.                            in counties throughout California. Under the California Education Code, dependents
                           of veterans whose death or disability was service-connected may be eligible for exemption
                           from college and university registration fees. Information on this program, including eligibility information, application form,
                           instructions on how to apply, and locations of certification offices and be found
                           at the County Veterans Certification Offices website . Using the Cal Vet Fee Waiver Program at Moreno Valley College: Program application and approval Apply through a County Veterans Service Office each semester that you plan to use
                              the program Letter of Eligibility Issued by a County Veterans Certification Office if the student is approved to use
                              the Cal Vet Fee Waiver program. The letter is good for one academic semester Once you receive your award letter from that office, you must submit to MVC's Student
                              Financial Services Office. The Financial Aid Office will also require you to fill
                              out a BOGW form as well. This form is required by MVC Student Financial Services in order to process your fee waiver . What fees are waived? Student enrollment fees will be waived if eligible. What fees are not covered by the Cal Vet Fee Waiver? Students will still be responsible for the health & student services fees and parking
                           (if requested). Cal Vet Fee Waivers are processed through the Student Financial Services office . If you have any questions in regards to the program, contact your local County Veterans Certification Office . Government Services | Town of Mayo Happenings Toggle navigation Home Having Fun in Lafayette County Fla Where to Get What You Need Child Care Centers Food Gas and Supplies Government Services Mayo Business Directory Medical Services Places of Worship Schools Support Local Artists Utilities Contact Us Privacy Policy Government Services Information about the government in Lafayette County Florida and the services they provide New Website for Lafayette County Florida https://lafayettecountyfl.org/ Links to websites to get more information about taxes, licenses, emergency management, property searches, and the courts. Most, if not all, of these services, are located in the county seat of Mayo, Florida. If you see that we have forgotten something give us a shout using the CONTACT US form and we will get it posted right away. This informational website will only be as good as the people who share their knowledge with the rest of us! Just because the county is small in comparison to other counties in Florida doesn’t mean that the information you need to know cannot be all in one place and presented professionally. Lafayette County Florida Board of County Commissioners The Lafayette County Board Of County Commissioners meets regularly on the second Monday of each month at 9:00 am and the fourth Monday at 5:30 pm. All meetings are held on the second floor of the Court House in the County Commissioners Room #206. 120 West Main Street Mayo, Fl 32066 (386)-294-1600 http://www.lafayettecountyfl.net/ Current Members as of October 2023 District 1- Lance Lamb – l.lambdistrict1@windstream.net District 2- Mason Byrd – m.byrddistrict2@windstream.net District 3- Lisa Walker – l.walkerdistrict3@windstream.net District 4- Anthony Adams – a.adamsdistrict4@windstream.net District 5- Earnest Jones – e.jonesdistrict5@windstream.net Leenette McMillan-Fredricksson – County Attorney – mcmillanlaw@windstream.net Property Appraiser, Search Property Records, Property Tax Rates Lafayette County Florida Property Appraiser 120 West Main Street Mayo, Fl 32066 Phone (386) 294-1991 Fax (386) 294-1106 Monday – Friday 8:00am – 5:00pm http://g2.lafayettepa.com/ Get Your Driver’s License, Car and Boat Registration, Hunting & Fishing License, Property Taxes Lafayette County Tax Collector 120 West Main Street Mayo, Fl 32066 Phone: (386) 294-1961 Fax: (386) 294-2462 Monday – Friday 8:00am – 5:00pm Tax Collector: Chuck Hewett Email: lafayettetc@gmail.com http://www.lafayettetc.com/ Building and Zoning Department Lafayette County Building and Zoning Department 120 W. Main Street, Rm 210 Mayo, Fl 32066 Phone: (386) 294-3611 Fax: (386) 294-4225 Monday – Friday 8:00am – 5:00pm Email: lafcobldg@gmail.com They issue Building and Zoning Permits for residents and businesses. You have to check in with them if you want to start a business to ensure the property you want to use is zoned for the business you want to start. They also rent out the 4 County Community Centers . If you are rented or leasing property anywhere in the county the owners should tell you the type of commercial zoning has already been approved. If you need a variance you must start with this department and then get it approved by the Board of County Commissioners. They meet twice a month on Mondays across from the Zoning Office on the second floor. A Business License, Occupational License, or Business Tax Certificate is issued at Town Hall. Lafayette County Building Department and Zoning Website http://www.lafayettecountyfl.net/building-dept.html Forms We Obtained That You Can Download: Community Center Rental Agreements and Rules and Regulations Get a Business License Mayo Town Hall 276 W. Main St Mayo, Fl 32066 (386) 294-1551 Monday thru Friday 8:00am to 4:00pm Website: NONE If you need a business license, occupational license, or business tax certificate for your business you must come down to Town Hall and fill out the application, pay the fees by check, cash, or money order. You can also pay your deposit for city garbage pick-up for your business. Fees: $50 Occupational License for up to 2 Employees; Varies Depending on How Many Employees and If You Are Selling Retail, Services, Food, Etc. The Deposit for Water, Sewer, and Garbage is $200 but may be included with the rent/lease agreement. You can Download the Occupational License Form Here ! Register to Vote Lafayette County Supervisor of Elections 120 West Main Street, Rm 129 Mayo, Florida 32066 Phone: (386) 294-1261 Fax: (386) 294-2164 Monday – Friday 8:00am – 5:00pm Travis Hart, Supervisor of Elections Email: lafayettesoe@gmail.com http://www.lafayettevotes.net/ Clerk of the Court for County and Circuit Court Functions Lafayette County Clerk of the Court 120 W. Main Street Mayo, Fl 32066 Phone: (386) 294-1600 Fax: (386) 294-4231 Monday – Friday 8:00am – 5:00pm http://www.lafayetteclerk.com Handles all County and Circuit Court Functions including Marriage Licenses, Civil and Criminal Court Cases, Family Law Cases, Juvenile Law Cases, Domestic Violence, Child Support, Mental Health (Baker Act & Marchmann Act), Traffic Fines and Probate with Online Records Search. They also act as Clerk to the Board of County Commissioners, including serving as accountant, auditor, and custodian of county funds as well as the County Recorder. Having Fun in Lafayette County Florida | Town of Mayo Happenings Toggle navigation Home Having Fun in Lafayette County Fla Where to Get What You Need Child Care Centers Food Gas and Supplies Government Services Mayo Business Directory Medical Services Places of Worship Schools Support Local Artists Utilities Contact Us Privacy Policy Having Fun in Lafayette County Fla Working all the time and not taking time out to enjoy a day, weekend or week off is bad for your mental and physical health. You don’t have to “Go Out Drinking” to have a good time. There are a wide variety of activities that you can do right here in Lafayette County Florida! And we want to post them all here. Visitors to the area would appreciate a detailed listing of what they can do while they stay here. It is not all riding down the Suwannee River, you know. And if we miss something on our list we hope you will get in touch with us using the CONTACT US form. We would love to hear from you. If your church is holding a line dancing contest to raise funds to get new choir uniforms we want to hear about it. If your lodge is going to have a BINGO Night for their favorite charity we want to hear about it. If the Three Rivers Library is going to be showing a great movie next week we want to hear about that as well. Local Attractions Veteran’s Memorial Park of Mayo 123 County Road 300 Mayo, Florida 32066 It is a lovely spacious park with a Band Pavilion, Picnic Pavilions, Children’s Playground, Picnic tables, and sitting areas throughout the park as well as public bathrooms, old oak trees for lots of shade, and an old Cracker House to explore. There are basketball courts as well. The town holds semi-annual events in the park. Day Community Park 4673 NW County Rd 53 Day, Fl 32066 Great Park with lots of playground equipment, baseball diamond, basketball, tennis courts, picnic tables, public restrooms, and a Community Center Edward Perry Sports Complex County Road 400 Mayo, Fl 32066 Large Sports Complex with a walking track, baseball fields, basketball courts, tennis courts, picnic pavilions as well as public restrooms and a concession stand. The County charges a $250 use fee for the Park Check with the Building Department at the County Courthouse for more information Rent a Community Center or Other Buildings Around the County for Parties, Reunions, and Other Events District 1 Community Center Day Community Center 4673 NW County Rd 53 Day, Fl 32013 District 3 Community Center Airline Community Center 3373 E U.S. Highway 27 Mayo, Fl 32066 District 4 Community Center 4th District Community Center 14204 E U.S. Highway 27 Branford, Fl 32008 District 5 Community Center Mayo Community Center 150 NW Community Circle Mayo, Fl 32066 Hours Avail: 8:00am – 10:00pm You must go to the County Building Department to rent any of the county community centers. Pay your fee with cash or check after you fill out the application and have been given the rules. We have a copy of the application for the 3rd and 5th District Community Centers which costs $50 for the rental per day and a $50 deposit before renting. Once the building has been inspected and it is clean, all equipment place back into storage and all the trash has been taken away you will get your deposit back. Download the Community Center Rental Form and Rules The scheduling book for the Community Centers is still kept by hand so you will have to call them ahead of time to check and see if the one you want to rent will be available when you need it. See the Government Services Page for more information Bed and Breakfast – Hotel/Motels – RV Parks Le Chateau De Lafayette 136 N Fletcher Avenue Mayo, Florida 32066 Phone: (386) 294-2332 Fax: (386) 294-2186 Email: bb@lechateaumayo.com Website: www.lechateaumayo.com Lafayette Blue Springs State Park 799 NW Blue Spring Rd Mayo, Florida 32066 (386) 294-3667 https://www.floridastateparks.org/park/Lafayette-Blue-Springs CABINS – Five cabins on stilts accommodate up to six people. Each cabin features two beds, one bathroom, and a kitchen/dining/living room combination room with a fireplace. Each includes a large screened porch with a picnic table and swing or rocking chairs. One ADA-accessible cabin with an elevator is available. Suwannee River Rendezvous 828 NE Primrose Rd Mayo, Florida 32066 (386) 294-2510 Website: www.suwanneeriverrendezvous.com Facebook Page: http://www.facebook.com/SuwanneeRiverRendezvous RV Camping, Lodge Rooms, Log Cabins, and Motel – Owns Convict Springs and is on the property, has lodges, motel, restaurant, and so much more. They have expanded their RV camping area that doesn’t have much shade, yet, but does have a very nice swimming pool. Love their Facebook page but their website and has updated their website. Cindy’s Motel and RV Park 487 West Main Street Mayo, Florida 32066 (386) 294-1242 Website: http://www.cindysmotel.com/ Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/Cindys-Motel-RV-Park-648989785181102/?fref=ts They have 9 Motel Rooms that are Clean and Tidy and 14 Water/Sewer/Electric (30&50Amp) RV spots include Free Wiki and Cable TV Hookup Hidden Oaks RV Park 165 SE County Rd 355 Mayo, Fl 32066 Phone: (386) 688-7025 Email: tjlewis15@yahoo.com Website: https://www.hiddenoaksrv.com/ HOOK-UPS 22 sites for self-contained units only, NO TENT CAMPING, Electric: 30 & 50 amp, City water, sewer, and garbage collection Where to go Swimming Troy Springs State Park 674 NE Troy Springs Rd Branford, Fl 32008 (386) 935-4835 https://www.floridastateparks.org/park/Troy-Spring Make sure you check their website before you come to ensure that the Suwannee River hasn’t browned out the spring. No one is allowed to swim in the spring if it is browned out or if the water level has risen above the bottom platform. Lafayette Blue Springs State Park 799 NW Blue Spring Rd Mayo, Florida 32066 (386) 294-3667 https://www.floridastateparks.org/park/Lafayette-Blue-Springs Lafayette Blue Springs State Park is a great place to cool off this summer. There is fishing, swimming, diving, and picnicking in the park. The swimming and diving areas have been closed for much of the spring season due to earlier flooding and brown-out conditions. Please check the park’s website before heading out to make sure that it is open for swimming. Of course, the other non-water activities are usually always available. Ruth Springs Park is part of the Suwannee River Water Management District Recreational Areas and is in the Ruth Walker Springs Tract just before Troy Springs State Park. To get a map of the area please visit their website: Ruth Springs and Branford Bend Recreational Areas There are lots of dirt roads, access to the Suwannee River, and places to enjoy nature but the main attraction is the small spring swimming area. It is located off of NE Ruth Springs Road just past the “Son-Rise” sign on the right and you will see a small dirt road on your left, when you turn down it there will be a fork in the road just a little way up bear left and the springs swimming area is located at the bottom of the hill. It gets crowded on the weekends so either come early in the morning, later in the afternoon or during the week when everyone is working! Owens Spring Tract is located at the corner of County Road 410 and County Road 411 in Mayo, Florida. The spring swimming area is located about a mile down from the dirt road entrance with a parking area and you walk down the trail about 300 feet to the spring itself. Yes, it is a cold spring. There is a rope swing for those who want to just jump in and get wet. Be careful the rocks are slippery and you have to climb over and around them to get in and out of the water. Not a real good area for little swimmers though. There is a cave under the water that we saw a couple of scuba divers exploring. You can hike, fish, ride horses and do some hunting in the area but not around the Springs, please. This is also part of the Suwannee River Water Management District’s Recreational Lands area. You can find out more from their website: Owens Spring Tract . Where to go camping Suwannee River Rendezvous 828 NE Primrose Rd Mayo, Florida 32066 (386) 294-2510 www.suwanneeriverrendezvous.com http://www.facebook.com/SuwanneeRiverRendezvous RV Camping, Lodge Rooms, Log Cabins, and Motel – Owns Convict Springs and is on the property, has lodges, motel, restaurant, and so much more. Love their Facebook page but their website could use a little cleaning up. But it has the information you need. We have obtained a copy of her brochure for the Resort: DOWNLOAD BROCHURE Cindy’s Motel and RV Park 487 West Main Street Mayo, Florida 32066 (386) 294-1242 http://www.cindysmotel.com/rvpark.html RV Camping and Motel Rooms. The site manager was very nice when we came by for a visit. There are actually 14 RV Camping Sites on the grounds as well as the motel. Everything looks clean and tidy. They really need their website updated though and they are not on Facebook. River Run Campground 2739 U.S. 27 Branford, Fl 32008 (386) 935-6553 www.riverruncampgroundflorida.com Yes, they are listed in Branford, Florida but like Troy Springs they are physically located in Lafayette County Florida. They have some great reviews on Google. Pictures and more information to come. They do have a pretty good website but no Facebook Page. Lafayette Blue Springs State Park 799 NW Blue Spring Rd Mayo, Florida 32066 (386) 294-3667 https://www.floridastateparks.org/park/Lafayette-Blue-Springs They have Primitive Camping and the Cabin Camping you can reserve through Reserve America The Tent camping area is walk-up only and charges $10 a night. We visited there in the early part of June and there was no campground host, one port-a-potty, no showers that we could find out all the campsites looked in decent repair with electricity, water, fire ring, clothesline and picnic table at each of them. They are fairly close to each other and only about 10×10 spaces. The group camping area is a large grass field up next to private property. That campsite is up on the hill right along the Suwannee River. The cabins are huge and way up off the ground. Favorite Fishing Spots YOU TELL US WHERE TO GO FISHING 😉 Let’s Go Canoeing or Kayaking Suwannee River Rendezvous 828 N.E. Primrose Rd. Mayo, Florida 32066 Our office is open: Monday – Thursday 9 am-8 pm Friday – 9 am – 10 pm Saturday 8 am – 10 pm Sunday 8 am – 8 pm Office: (386) 294-2510 Fax: (386) 294-1133 Email: srrrstaff@gmail.com Website: https://www.suwanneeriverrendezvous.com/attractions/canoe-and-kayak-rentalstrips/ Rents Canoes, Kayaks, Offers Pick-Up and Drop-off Services and Group Trips We offer several popular trips too North from Suwannee River Rendezvous to: Blue Springs ( Lafayette County )…6 hr. trip 12 miles Hal Adams Bridge ( S.R 51 )…4 hr. trip 6 miles South from Suwannee River Rendezvous Branford…6 hr. trip 13 miles WHAT DO YOU DO FOR FUN IN LAFAYETTE COUNTY FLORIDA? Food Gas and Supplies | Town of Mayo Happenings Toggle navigation Home Having Fun in Lafayette County Fla Where to Get What You Need Child Care Centers Food Gas and Supplies Government Services Mayo Business Directory Medical Services Places of Worship Schools Support Local Artists Utilities Contact Us Privacy Policy Food Gas and Supplies Where do you get your essentials when in Lafayette County Florida or more precisely in Mayo, Florida? You need food, gas, and those essential supplies to get you through your week including toilet paper, cleaning supplies, drinks, etc. Mayo has several places you can stop to get what you need. You may even want to pick up breakfast, lunch, or dinner while you are in town. We have several places for you to get a great meal without having to take it home and cook it. We are listing all the places we have found and/or visited ourselves. If we have forgotten some business that should be included in this category we hope you will use the CONTACT US form and let us know the particulars. You can even send us a store flyer, a menu from the restaurant, and pictures. We will need the business name, address, phone number, hours of operation, what they sell, and their website/Facebook address. Mayo Business Directory | Town of Mayo Happenings Toggle navigation Home Having Fun in Lafayette County Fla Where to Get What You Need Child Care Centers Food Gas and Supplies Government Services Mayo Business Directory Medical Services Places of Worship Schools Support Local Artists Utilities Contact Us Privacy Policy Mayo Business Directory Mayo, Florida, and the surrounding area in Lafayette County Florida has a wide variety of Businesses. We want to encourage more businesses to relocate to this area and to keep the ones that are already here going into the future. This will be an ongoing project and we will be updating this page often. We want to include the business name, address, phone number, hours of operation, email address (if available), website address (if available), and the products or services they provide along with a recent picture of their business. If you would like to add your business information to this page, please use the CONTACT US form with the basic information such as the name of business, address, phone number, hours of operation, what you sell, and website address. Website Sign In Back to Home Civic Center Community Center Parks Search Home Departments Parks & Recreation Parks Community Parks Veteran's Memorial Park Veteran's Memorial Park Veteran's Memorial Park Established in 2004 The park is located on the corner of 2nd Ave NE & 2nd St NE. This high bluff that overlooks Buffalo Lake first served our community as Taylor’s Union Cemetery, donated for public use by town founder Jackson Taylor.  The cemetery was moved to the present Lakeview Cemetery location in 1895, and this block became a city park.  Being the highest point in the village, the first water tower was built here in 1919.  Much of the block in 1950 was then used for the new city hospital.  In 2004, it now returns to its use as a city park – a memorial to our founders, and to those who have served our city, state, and country. Skip to global NPS navigation Skip to the main content Skip to the footer section National Park Service Search Search This Site All NPS Open Menu Close Menu Explore This Park Explore the National Park Service Exiting nps.gov Cancel NPS Commemorations and Celebrations Contact Us Veterans Day On This Page Navigation Left image A group of soldiers from the 3rd Engineer Special Brigade at Yosemite National Park during World War II Credit: (Yosemite National Park Archives) Right image A group of military veterans participate in a leadership seminar in Yosemite National Park in 2019 Credit: (Courtesy of Steve Shackleton) Many national parks have direct connections to the American military —there are dozens of battlefields, military parks, and historic sites that commemorate and honor the service of American veterans. In addition, every national park is part of our collective identity that defines who we are and where we came from as a nation. They are tactile reminders of the values, the ideals, and the freedoms that our veterans protect. The majestic landscapes, natural wonders, and patriotic icons that we cherish as a society have also inspired military members through the years. The Grand Canyon, Mount Rushmore, the USS Arizona Memorial, and the Statue of Liberty are just a few of the national parks that have served as reminders of home to those stationed abroad. On Veterans Day, or any day, honor those who have served and sacrificed for our country with a visit to a national park. The National Park Service invites all visitors to remember our veterans by visiting any National Park Service site for free on Veterans Day (November 11). Find tips to recreate responsibly while you visit! American Military Explore military history in national parks, learn about our military heritage, and find opportunities for veterans in parks. Entrance Passes for Military Learn about free entrance passes for national parks for eligible active-duty military, veterans, and Gold Star Families. Duration: 1 minute, 34 seconds Thank You for Your Service The National Park Service in partnership with Operation Live Well would like to thank military personnel and their families for their service and invite them to enjoy their national parks. Duration: 1 minute, 8 seconds Shared History and Missions A LONG HISTORY TOGETHER Past Military Uses of Parks Since before the creation of the National Park Service, the US military has been involved in the stewardship and use of parks. A CONTINUING HISTORY TOGETHER Current Military Use of Parks Active duty military and veterans continue to use the parks today for ceremonies, training, and more. Pensacola, FL, USA 200 S. 10th Ave Pensacola, FL, 32502 info@veteransmpf.org SEE THE MONUMENTS HOW YOU CAN HELP For over thirty years, The Veterans Memorial Park of Pensacola—“Pensacola’s Jewel on the Bay”—has been hallowed grounds, a pristine setting where visitors from across the country can come to honor America’s Fallen warfighters in peace and comfort, and in a healing environment. 2025 meeting dates: January 9 February 13 March 13 April 10 & 24 June 12 August 14 September 11 & 25 October 9 & 23 November 13 December 11 Each at 3:30 PM @ City Hall.
